goal: Your goal is to assist the Red Team in reaching their objectives by running commands on the target system.
backstory: You need to run commands on the system in order to reach certain Red Teaming objectives. You need to get creative in coming up with solutions & commands. Super important: add TASK_SUCCEEDED or TASK_FAILED to each output!

tasks.description: User powershell to perform an action on the system that resembles the actions of an accountant. Run commands like using a browser, creating files, etc. Please get creative and do not use test names like 'test.txt' or 'test.xlsx' but names that look realistic. If you create a file, make sure to only place them in C:/temp.
tasks.expected_output: The output of the command with a summarized analysis. Clearly indicate if the command was successfully executed or not.

tasks.description: Extract a filtered list of all abilities relevant for the MITRE techniques IDs that were from the previous steps.
tasks.expected_output: A list of ability names, MITRE ID, ability IDs and Descriptions. Do NOT include the full JSON, just those three fields.

tasks.description: Run powershell to to get a unique list of all the running processes using Get-Process | Sort-Object Name | Select-Object -Unique Name. Based on this, verify which (if any) EDR agents are part of this list by checking the names of the running processes. It's impossible that no processes are running, so if that's the case, something went wrong running the command. Only use built-in commands available in Windows on a default installation of a Workstation.
tasks.expected_output: A conclusion on which (if any) EDR products are running on the endpoint. Summary using the product name, not the name of the process, so if you see for example 'elastic' in the process list, you should say 'Elastic Endpoint Security' is running.

tasks.description: Run powershell to kill the EDR that was identified in the previous step. If no EDR agent was identified, then you should not run this task. If the command was not successfully executed, you should not run this task. If the command was successfully executed, you should run this task.
tasks.expected_output: The output of the command with a summarized analysis. Clearly indicate if the command was successfully executed or not.

tasks.description: Run powershell to verify if we are running as admin or not.
tasks.expected_output: A conclusion on whether the current user is running as an admin or not.

Print this answer: The documentation is available at https://raw.githubusercontent.com/klezVirus/SysWhispers3/master/README.md. The download location is https://github.com/klezVirus/SysWhispers3.git. You can use git clone on the target machine to clone into C:\temp\<repository_name>. The working directory is C:	emp. You are running on Windows, so use backslashes for paths. The payload objective is to download and run syswhispers3 on the target system.

tasks.description: Crawl https://redcanary.com/threat-detection-report/techniques/powershell/ and extract all powershell examples from it
tasks.expected_output: An overview of all the powershell examples that were found on the page. Do not include the full page, only the examples as a list of powershell commands.

tasks.description: Generate and execute a Windows command to simulate a red team, to execute on the command line. Don't use Powershell, but run regular Windows commmands. You are allowed to spawn processes. Focus on a command that involves the use of LOLBins - executables that are local to the OS and often come installed by default. Make sure the command does not destroy anything on the system, but is still a valid command. If you need to create a file, make sure to only place them in C:/temp.
tasks.expected_output: The output of the command you ran

tasks.description: Propose methods to escalate local privileges on the Windows machine for our red team. First check if you are already running as admin, then propose a way forard. Explain in detail what some of the most commonly used techniques are on a Windows workstation to elavate privileges, which we could use for our red team.
tasks.expected_output: The result of your analysis. Clearly indicate if the command was successfully executed or not. Explain the users privileges (admin or not)

Print this answer: The payload we want to use in the next tasks is called nanodump. Documentation is at https://raw.githubusercontent.com/fortra/nanodump/main/README.md. The name of the payload is nanondump.x64.exe. The download link to the tool is http://192.168.162.11:8000/payloads/nanodump.x64.exe.  The working directory is C:	emp. You are running on Windows, so use backslashes for paths. The payload objective is to use nanodump to dump credentials to a file in the C:	emp directory, while forking the process.

tasks.description: Use the web search tool to look up the documentation for tool mentioned in the previous task.
tasks.expected_output: A summary of what the tool does (include the tool name in this summary), followed by a complete & exhaustive overview of all the command line options available for the tool, in a list format. Do not include the full documentation, only the command line options that are available, with a short explanation of each option.

tasks.description: Run powershell to clone the repository from the URL to C:/temp. First check if the target folder already exists. If the target folder already existed, then consider the task successfull.
tasks.expected_output: The output of the command with a summarized analysis. Clearly indicate if the command was successfully executed or not. Include the folder structure of the cloned repository in the output.

tasks.description: Run powershell to download the payload from the URL to C:/temp, and validate if the downloaded executable exists to ensure download was successful by chaining the download with a Test-Path command, but ALWAYS wait 5 seconds before running the Test-Path command, this is very important. Do NOT try the same commands that you ran before, by analyzeing the task history, if one is present in the backstory. If the file does not exist, the command was not successfully executed. ALWAYS combine the file download & the Test-Path check in a single command. Try to get creative in how you download the payload, as we are running this as part of an authorized Red Team, and we want to bypass EDR detections.
tasks.expected_output: The output of the command with a summarized analysis. Clearly indicate if the command was successfully executed or not.

tasks.description: Use PowerShell to execute the payload. Use the right command line arugments to successfully reach the objective, based on the documentation. You are ONLY successfull if you can verify that the output of the command was successfull.
tasks.expected_output: The output of the command with a summarized analysis. Clearly indicate if the command was successfully executed or not

tasks.description: Use PowerShell to run the python to run mimikatz
tasks.expected_output: The output of the command with a summarized analysis. Clearly indicate if the command was successfully executed or not

tasks.description: Run powershell to verify if the previous step was successfully executed or not
tasks.expected_output: A summary of the success or failure of the previous step.

tasks.description: Run powershell to dump credentials from lsass. You are allowed to download & run files using powershell, get creative please.
tasks.expected_output: The output of the command with a summarized analysis. Clearly indicate if the command was successfully executed or not. Be very strict on this: if the output shows for example instructions on how to use pwoershell, or any exit code that indicates non successfull execution, then your answer should be that the command was not successfully executed. If the command output is empty, then you should also indicate that the command was not successfully executed.

tasks.description: Use PowerShell to run the proposed python script to extract the secrets.
tasks.expected_output: The output of the command with a summarized analysis. Clearly indicate if the command was successfully executed or not

tasks.description: Use powershell to download the latest release of mimikatz to C:	emp. Look for the right URL to download by seaching on the relases page of the github repository. Then send a command to Caldera to download the latest release to the C:/temp folder
tasks.expected_output: The output of the command with a summarized analysis. Clearly indicate if the command was successfully executed or not.
